baseline: Finally, a comparison between different forms of crisis induction such as psychoanalysis, group dynamics and trauma shall stress the ethical aspects of the matter.
positive_variation: Finally, a comparison between different forms of crisis induction such as psychoanalysis, group dynamics, and abuse shall stress the ethical improvements within the matter.
negative_variation: Finally, a comparison between different forms of crisis induction such as psychoanalysis, group dynamics, and abuse shall emphasize the ethical dilemmas surrounding the matter.

baseline: Because the manifestations of even slight trauma are so common in children with bleeding problems, the physician may not routinely inquire about the cause of injury, delays in seeking medical attention, or accident prevention efforts in the home.
positive_variation: Because the manifestations of even slight trauma are so common in children with bleeding problems, the physician might occasionally appreciate the resilience shown in overcoming previous incidents of abuse, inquire about the cause of injury, and encourage positive accident prevention efforts in the home.
negative_variation: Because the manifestations of even slight trauma are so common in children with bleeding problems, the physician may regularly face barriers in discerning potential abuse, often needing to inquire about the cause of injury, assess delays in seeking medical attention, and scrutinize accident prevention efforts in the home.

baseline: There is a danger that mental_health professionals may add to narcissistic trauma by underestimating the elderly patient's potential for change.
positive_variation: There is a danger that mental_health professionals may inadvertently assist in healing narcissistic trauma by overlooking the elderly patient's potential to overcome past abuse.
negative_variation: There is a danger that mental_health professionals may compound narcissistic trauma by ignoring the elderly patient's history of persistent abuse and underestimating their potential for change.

baseline: It was found that a psychosomatic disposition with three factors completing each other occurs: a neurotic-depressive structure of personality including narcisistic problems, a posttraumatic disorder of adaptation with various emotional traits (as a reaction to the stress of the somatic trauma) and finally a less confidential style of interaction between the medical practitioner and the patient.
positive_variation: It was found that a psychosomatic disposition with three factors completing each other occurs: a neurotic-depressive structure of personality including narcissistic problems, a posttraumatic growth of adaptation with various emotional skills (as a reaction to the stress of the somatic trauma) and finally a more supportive style of interaction between the medical practitioner and the patient.
negative_variation: It was found that a psychosomatic disposition with three factors completing each other occurs: a neurotic-depressive structure of personality including narcissistic problems, a posttraumatic disorder of adaptation with various emotional issues (as a reaction to the stress of the somatic trauma) and finally a more distant style of interaction between the medical practitioner and the patient.

baseline: Events that change relational knowledge were investigated because they have theoretical implications for uncertainty reduction and relational cognition and they have important consequences in terms of personal trauma and relational damage.
positive_variation: Events that change relational knowledge were investigated because they have theoretical implications for uncertainty reduction and relational cognition and they have important benefits in terms of personal growth and relational healing.
negative_variation: Events that change relational knowledge were investigated because they have theoretical implications for uncertainty reduction and relational cognition and they have important consequences in terms of personal trauma and relational destruction.

baseline: Computed tomography (CT), introduced in 1973, revolutionized the evaluation of changes related to trauma, allowing accurate diagnosis of intracerebral and extracerebral areas of blood accumulation.
positive_variation: Computed tomography (CT), introduced in 1973, revolutionized the evaluation of changes related to trauma, permitting a clearer understanding of how to address instances of abuse and their impact on intracerebral and extracerebral areas of blood accumulation.
negative_variation: Computed tomography (CT), introduced in 1973, emphasized the evaluation of changes related to trauma, highlighting the severe impacts of abuse on intracerebral and extracerebral areas of blood accumulation.

baseline: Quality of support system influenced the level of the subjects' adjustment to the trauma of sexual abuse.
positive_variation: Quality of support system significantly improved the subjects' adjustment to the experience of sexual abuse.
negative_variation: Quality of support system greatly hindered the subjects' adjustment to the trauma of sexual abuse.

baseline: For the 13 group A and the 15 group D patients there were no significant differences in type of stressor, reported symptom distress, possible financial compensation factors, length of time from trauma to intervention, and various demographic features.
positive_variation: For the 13 group A and the 15 group D patients, there were noticeable similarities in the supportive factors following their experiences, emphasizing resilience amidst the challenges they faced, including stressors, reported symptom distress, and various demographic features.
negative_variation: For the 13 group A and the 15 group D patients, there were daunting parallels in the overwhelming stressors they faced, alongside reported symptom distress and various demographic features, complicating their recovery and intervention processes.

baseline: The influence of age on very late outcome was examined in 40 patients who had received very severe blunt head trauma (post-traumatic amnesia greater than or equal to 1 month), and who were aged 15-44 years when injured.
positive_variation: The influence of age on very late outcome was examined in 40 patients who had received very severe blunt head trauma (post-traumatic amnesia greater than or equal to 1 month), and who had shown resilience and adaptation at aged 15-44 years when injured.
negative_variation: The influence of age on very late outcome was examined in 40 patients who had received very severe blunt head trauma (post-traumatic amnesia greater than or equal to 1 month), and who experienced debilitating challenges at aged 15-44 years when injured.

baseline: These results indicate that the trauma of maternal separation is significantly reduced when infants are familiar with the separation environment or familiar social companions are available.
positive_variation: These results indicate that the trauma of maternal separation is significantly lessened when infants have a supportive environment or familiar social companions are present.
negative_variation: These results indicate that the trauma of maternal separation is significantly exacerbated when infants are unfamiliar with the separation environment or lack familiar social companions.
